title: Omni New Haven Hotel workers enter day 2 of strike
text:
By Marcy Jones Published: Sep. 13, 2024 at 4:40 AM EDT | Updated: 2 hours ago Email This Link
Share on Facebook
Share on X (formerly Twitter)
Share on Pinterest
Share on LinkedIn
NEW HAVEN, CT (WFSB) - More than 100 workers were expected to picket in front of the Omni New Haven Hotel on Friday.
It marked day two of the strike , and workers said the decision to picket was not taken lightly. They added that they’ve been negotiating with the hotel since November. Their contract expired at the end of March.
The workers included housekeepers, bartenders, servers, and chefs represented by Local 217, the Unite Here union.
On Thursday, they began striking, carrying signs, and chanting.
They said they felt overworked, underpaid, and exhausted after months of slow-moving negotiations.
“We’re just looking for a way for people to get back on their feet,” said Josh Stanley, secretary treasurer, Local 217 Unite Here. “We’re talking about fair wages stable retirement and healthcare.”
Omni Hotels and Resorts said this was not its first time dealing with something like this.
In response to the strike, it said in part:
“Unfortunately, as has recently occurred in other markets, the union has determined that a strike is in its interest. In view of this labor action, the hotel has put in place plans to ensure services are not interrupted and that our guests will continue to experience the genuine hospitality, personalized service, and elevated experiences that are the hallmark of the Omni New Haven Hotel.”
